column4: the tracker had 2 somethings going on... but when I opened it, it didn't show anything...
it says starting sessions... and then it just disappears.
how do I find out if it's my HD or a software problem?
what good is changing my tracker settings if Ubuntu isn't running properly?
first I noticed FireFox wasn't saving HTML pages. then I noticed it wasn't saving images.

then it started having problems loading web pages and it froze up when I tried to copy the URL to a link file. so I switched terminals even though I have no idea what to actually do in other terminals, and when I came back and lots of windows were glitched and missing contents.
Because I save "save page as" and hit enter and no files are created. same with image files.
oh. error in the terminal. (firefox:32281): GnomeUI-WARNING **: While connecting to session manager:
Authentication Rejected, reason : None of the authentication protocols specified are supported and host-based authentication failed.
... hm... I checked one partition but not the system partition...
boot off a live cd & fsck
yeah, best backup before you go there..
